newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway gives aid to developing oil nations.
newsitem.headline: Norway gives aid to developing oil nations.

text.p: The Norwegian Agency for Development Cooperation (NORAD) will donate around 50 million crowns to developing oil producing nations in 1996, officials said on Thursday.

The Norwegian Oil Directorate, NORAD and the International Programme for Petroleum Management and Administration (PETRAD) are working together to transfer competence in the oil industry to 20 developing nations.
Most of the money will go to Africa, where the directorate is supporting oil projects in Namibia, Tanzania, Mozambique, Angola, South Africa and Eritrea, officials told a press conference.
The initiative aims to provide Norwegian experience and expertise with country's striving to build up their oil industries.
"The fact that Norway ia a small land without an imperialistic past is important and creates goodwill," said Fredrik Hagemann, director at the directorate.
Hagemann said one project yielding prmising results was with Indian oil authorities, which had received advice on building up a directorate to monitor hydrocarbon exploration and production.

NORAD and the directorate are also sponsoring development of a gas pipeline in South Africa between Johannesburg and Maputo, as well as other projects in the Seychelles, Bangladesh, Vietnam and Nicaragua.
